Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go offline 3. Create a report with two manual expenses and any category (Uncategorized appears when there is no category in workspace settings > Categories) 4. Go to the report thread 5. Resize the window until the "Select all" label appears (only on Web) ## Expected Result: Select All and Uncategorized are greyed out. ## Actual Result: Select All and Uncategorized are not greyed out as all other IU components. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1bd8fb8e-0ceb-47d1-8d71-ace245191ef8 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.66-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2227/folder/13177075/41237833/1045762614 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** joelarmandotester+595@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** IPhone 12 / IOS 26.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Open the Hybrid app. 2. Create a new account. 3. Start a chat with any user. 4. Create an expense. 5. In the description section, type any comments and swipe right to go back without saving your changes. 6. Tap on create expense button. ## Expected Result: It should avoid going back without displaying the modal to discard the changes made to the description. ## Actual Result: The modal for discarding changes made is not displayed, which causes the expense to load indefinitely when it is created. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a9e86fc3-fe02-47ec-b7f1-d30f66f517ee [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.66-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75718 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdnsoijsonjsdisdoj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Bug 1: 1.Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two empty reports. 4. On the first empty report preview, click Add expense > Create expense. 5. Complete the flow to create an expense in the first report. Bug 2: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two reports. 4. Rename the reports above to A and B respectively. 5. Open FAB > Create expense > Manual. 6. Enter amount > Next. 7. On confirm page, enter merchant. 8. On confirm page, click Report field. 9. Select Report A. 10. Click Create expense. 11. Go back to workspace chat. ## Expected Result: Bug 1: The new expense will be created in the first report. Bug 2: The new expense will be created in Report A. ## Actual Result: Bug 1: The new expense is created in the second report when it is created from the first report. Bug 2: The new expense is created in Report B, but it opens Report A after creating the expense. This issue also happens when Step 6 is performed in the workspace chat, or when submitting expense in self DM to workspace chat with the same Step 8 to 11. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/07377b2c-f248-4c79-8a31-01037aef8d66 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9da831a1-7146-4ebe-8b46-15feebb04261 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.65-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** No **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify ## Action Performed: 1. Create a workspace 2. Enable Rules 3. Go to Categories 4. Click on a category 5. Click on "Flag amounts over" 6. Click on Type ## Expected Result: Small copy update to insert the word "daily": > **Category total** > Flag total daily category spend per expense report. ## Actual Result: The copy doesn't include the word "daily", but that's how the feature works. It will throw a violation if the total of expenses with the same category and the same expense date on the same report exceed the limit. > **Category total** > Flag total category spend per expense report. ## Workaround: N/A copy change. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Change option row and push inputs chevrons to new look

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

body:
Now that we have changed the chevrons (the little > icon) of the workspace editor and expenses/reports, it's time to bring the consistency over to push inputs and option rows For all pushrows and options rows: Spec: Notes: - Icon goes from 20px -> 16px - Icon goes from 100% opacity to 50% opacity - Icon should be 100% opacity on hover - We wanna make sure we do a test build of this before we merge it into the product - All other layout should stay the same cc @Expensify/design @Expensify/product-pr
